title: To all the people making fun of SKT

replies.body:
Well said Fitzky! It was an amazing set of games by SSG, and SKT have had an amazing streak of dominance. I think people are expressing that they are happy that there is competition despite Faker being the best player in the world and SKT being the best 'Worlds' team. Obviously the way it has come across is not cool and I hope they take the time to read your post.

WP!

I recently read the all time classic To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee. Fantastic book, and one of my favourite book quotes comes from it:

_“You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it.”_

When people write these kind of comments, they fail to consider things from the persons point of view that they are attacking. Fakers reputation was on the line this year and his team and his fans were relying on him to play to the remarkable level of skill which he usually puts on display, so it was completely understandable when he crumbled beneath all the pressure placed on him.

To some this may seem like a game, but to Faker this is his career and his lifestyle. Comments which are written out of ignorance, lack of empathy and complete disregard for the feelings of the person being attacked are actually an ever growing issue on the internet that is rarely addressed, and this is a prime example of that. 

I know Faker and the rest of SKT will recover from this loss, and quite frankly it's such a shame that this years finale was ruined by all the toxicity from the community. It was such an epic finale and an absolute blast to watch, I never would have expected an SSG win, but I feel ashamed to be part of a community which can so quickly turn to bash and criticise one of its most praised and highly regarded players after one loss.

he probably had a breakdown where you cant control your emotions from the overwhelming pressure and stress of skt under performing and that was the  final tipping point. its really not an uncommon thing to happen to people. how you look at it all just comes down to maturity, which is few and far between with lol players.

Grand Finals are an emotional time. I imagine worlds is a shit ton worse. I've seen grown football players barely keeping it together or openly weeping after grand final losses and that's amateur sport. Losing something you've worked all year for and spilt blood, sweat and tears for is devastating. 

Quite frankly all I get out of seeing someone cry after losing on that kind of stage is that they really really wanted it. Crying doesn't make you any less of a person.

I can say in all honesty, I couldn't really care about either team, or any team at all tbh.
_(When one team can just buy players from another, all competition loses any meaning in my eyes.)_

But when I think about how many less Zeds I would have vsed if it hadn't been for Faker.......
How many hours of misery I have had because of my lane being filled game after game after game with the same faker copycat/wannabes and their cancer champs.....
That's why I throughly enjoyed Faker breaking down.

For no other reason.

*cough* Lucian Mid *cough*

So frustrating when my Mid Laners picked this a day after, and they all fed their faces off T_T
What happened to your purple name?
I dont know haha, sometimes it shows up, sometimes not :P
I'd say it's probably specifically the Esports boards
Could be, I am knowledgeable in absolutely nothing relating to E-sports xD

Yeah I’m on the same page. It was good for someone to knock off the champs but I hold no ill will agaisnt Faker. Perhaps someone of the butt hurt comes simply from the way they kept getting into situations where they would surely lose and then somehow pull the cat out of the bag. 

As far as his stats go this was his best worlds. Unfortunately the team around him just wasn’t playing as well. Huni has always been hit or miss, he either carries or feeds. The SKT style essentially turned Peanut into a warding bot and didn’t let him play his style like he had on the Koo Tigers. But the real difference this year was in the bot lane. Bang and Wolf have been solid for years. Very rarely getting behind and absorbing pressure so the jungler could focus on Faker/Top lane. This year though they really really struggled. Team after team punished them in the area and it became pretty clear I think in groups and quarter finals that it was probably just a matter of time before someone took proper advantage of it.

Couldn't have said it better. As you say, sure we were all glad on some level that they got dethroned, but that doesn't mean they suck all of a sudden. Second in the world (for this year) is still a darn sight better that a vast percentage of the player population, and they still hold a significant and impressive record all their own.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

and not one of those ugly comments can be backed up with game play, none of them will ever get to worlds and, probably never get to qualifiers and with their ugly hateful minds never get a girl either

Exactly! It's incredibly unrealistic for SKT to win every Worlds, especially with a different roster. SSG didn't win because SKT sucked, but rather because they worked hard to become good enough to beat the best. What they've done is raise the bar of Pro Play yet again. 

And to those Faker bashers, he played to the best of his abilities. Not once did he give up, even when other members on his team fell behind. His deaths weren't due to insane outplays, but rather the enemy realising him as a high priority target. No one has the right to hate on someone for trying their best and performing their best. Chances are most of these haters are low elo players who don't understand that.
